Broccoli is a good source of vitamins A, C, and K, as well as dietary fiber. It has been linked to a reduced risk of certain cancers, improved digestive health, and improved heart health.

Broccoli is a nutrient-dense vegetable that is high in vitamins, minerals, and fiber. It is a good source of vitamins C and K, folate, potassium, and magnesium, as well as dietary fiber. Eating broccoli can help improve heart health, reduce inflammation, and support digestive health.
